Description: Dull white glazed composition amuletic figure in the form of the flattened face of the bearded god Bes, with flat back. Hair, brow and beard are decorated with series of parallel incised lines; the top of the head is perforated widthways with a long suspension hole.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, possibly from Tell Dafana, according to the context of the item in the list.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 par. 79) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.61, p.180, pl.22)
